skillTree.localised_description: No hide nor armour can stand against the piercing fury of a Dryad or Tree Kin's savage limbs.

skillTree.localised_description: Hewn from the same forest that surrounds them, Tree Kin withstand attacks like the forest withstands the fury of the seasons.

effects.description:

skillTree.localised_description: A ranger should give no reprieve to the foe. Arrows must fall like a deluge, as deadly as lightning.
Elven hunters emulate Kurnous, the God of the Hunt. Their speed and swiftness is therefore without peer.
Countless augmentations and enchantments on Amadriâ€™s body have rendered him impervious to physical threats.
The spirits who reside within Athel Loren are myriad. Those who serve the Mage Queen Ariel are guaranteed their protection and their aid.
Unable to forget his tortured past, Amadri embraces his thirst for vengeance and embarks upon a dark path to retribution, corrupting the spirits that follow him with malice.

effects.description: Malevolent Tree Spirits will be added to your Regiments of Renown tab (Next Turn)
Weapon Strength: +35% when fighting against Slaanesh

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: Though he is unable to forget his torment, Amadri resists his thirst for vengeance, placing the needs of the Forest above his own grudges.

effects.description: Tree Spirits will be added to your Regiments of Renown tab (Next Turn)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: The curse that was placed by the Daemonettes prior to Amadri Dawnspearâ€™s death had unforeseen consequences; it shifted Amadriâ€™s consciousness to a Tree Kin the moment his mortal form expired. Amadri Ironbark retains memories of his past and is the first Tree Kin to rule a realm within the dense forest of Athel Loren.

Amadriâ€™s vengeance isnâ€™t solely targeted towards Slaanesh. All who follow the Ruinous Powers are an affront to nature itself.

skillTree.localised_description: Amadriâ€™s primary weapon during his mortal life has not been cast aside after his rebirth. The spear is now magically infused to be launched at distant enemies.

skillTree.localised_name: Warden of the Vaults of Winter
skillTree.localised_description: The realm of Arranoc shares its borders with the menacing Vaults of Winter. In these Vaults, thousands of Daemons of Slaanesh and other evil creatures are kept under unstable imprisonment, the integrity of the SÃ­nann-Torr waystones fluctuating at the whims of the Winds of Magic. Thus, the realm is under constant siege from the darkness that lurks inside the Vaults.

	(factionwide)

Cause terror when fighting against Slaanesh
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

effects.description:
Attrition: -20% when under siege
	(armies in local owned region)

skillTree.localised_description: The High Realm of Arranoc, also known as the Summerstrand, is a lush and elegant region whose verdant reaches are never touched by winter. Here, the glades are ever dappled by brilliant sunshine all year round. Likewise, night seldom falls in this part of the forest, and even when it does, the hours of darkness are few and fleeting. Arranocâ€™s Lord, Amadri Dawnspear, still rules the realm, reborn as Amadri Ironbark.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.
Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.
When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75

skillTree.localised_description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark â€“ when they do, the forestâ€™s infinite anger is truly felt.

skillTree.localised_description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.
Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.
The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.
The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.
The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.
From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in themâ€¦

Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.
A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
This unit can pass through trees.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

items.colour_text: Since his transformation, Amadriâ€™s wooden body has been enchanted with powerful magics by the Summerstrandâ€™s Spellsinger, Arieth, to fortify his bark against attack.

A Slaaneshi talisman, looted from the corpse of one of his Daemonette captors, is kept by Amadri as a symbol of his painful past and his desire for vengeance. To further spite the Perfect Prince, the talisman has been purified of its Chaotic energies, draining the taint from the souls of anguished Slaaneshi worshippers.

effects.description:
Ward Save: +10% for all Trees
	(Lord's army)

Missile Damage: +15 when fighting against Slaanesh
	(factionwide)

Weapon Strength: +15% when fighting against Slaanesh
	(factionwide)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Amadri Dawnspear was tortured to death by vile Daemonettes. So eager were they to ensure that Amadri experienced the full measure of their tortures, the Daemonettes placed a curse on him so that no detail of it would ever escape his senses. They soon came to regret this when Amadriâ€™s mortal form perished, for their enchantment bound also the Tree Kin he became in the hour of his death. Fully aware of his fate and of his tormentors, Amadri soon took cruel vengeance of his own. Now and forever haunted by a pain he no longer truly feels, the reborn Amadri Ironbark rules Arranoc still.

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
